Katt Williams.... |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090205174732/http://abclocal.go.com/wpvi/story?section=news/entertainment&id=4852499 |archivedate=February 5, 2009 |df= }}</ref> (born September 2, 1971)<!--- born 1971, not 1973--><ref name=tmz>{{cite web| url = http://cdn.digitalcity.com/tmz_documents/111306_katt_williams_wm.pdf | title= The People of the State of California v Micah Sierra Williams (09/02/1971) a.k.a. Katt Williams, Jr., a.k.a. Katt Williams| publisher=Superior Court for the State of California for the County of Los Angeles via [[TMZ.com]] / DigitalCity.com| date= November 9, 2006| accessdate= April 28, 2016 | archivedate= December 9, 2014 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141209211521/http://cdn.digitalcity.com/tmz_documents/111306_katt_williams_wm.pdf | deadurl=no}}</ref><ref name=officialbio /> is an [[United States|American]] stand-up comedian, actor, rapper,<ref>{{cite news |title=Comedian Katt Williams faces burglary charges in Georgia |author=Dionne Walker |url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/life/people/2009-11-09-katt-williams-arrested_N.htm |agency=Associated Press |date=9 November 2009 |accessdate=2 December 2012 |work=USA Today}}</ref> singer, and voice actor. He had a role as Money Mike in ''[[Friday After Next]]'', had a stint on ''[[Wild 'n Out]]'', portrayed Bobby Shaw in ''[[My Wife and Kids]]'', provided the voice of A Pimp Named Slickback in ''[[The Boondocks (TV series)|The Boondocks]]'', Seamus in ''[[Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore]]'', and portrayed Lord Have Mercy in ''[[Norbit]]''. In 2008, he voiced himself in the video game ''[[Grand Theft Auto IV]]''.
==Early life== Williams was born Micah Sierra Williams on September 2, 1971 in [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]]. He was raised in Dayton, Ohio.<ref name=officialbio>{{cite web| url = http://kattwilliams.com/bio/| title= Bio| publisher=Katt Williams official website|accessdate= April 28, 2016|archivedate= April 2, 2016| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160402111134/http://kattwilliams.com/bio/ | deadurl=no}}</ref> Williams [[Emancipation of minors|emancipated]] himself from his parents at the age of 13, moved to Florida, and supported himself as a street vendor.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/people/katt-williams-21129883#early-life|title=Katt Williams Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=bio.|publisher=A&E Television Networks|access-date=May 9, 2016}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{cite news|url=https://nypost.com/2014/08/09/the-bizarre-chaotic-life-of-katt-williams-comedys-wildest-man/|title=The chaotic life of comedy's greatest mystery|last1=Getlen|first1=Larry|date=August 9, 2014|work=New York Post|accessdate=May 16, 2018|agency=New York Post}}</ref>
==Career==
===Stand-up career=== Williams started performing comedy in his Cincinnati neighborhood, [[Evanston, Cincinnati|Evanston]].<ref name="Katt Williams Biography 1">{{cite web|url=http://www.kattwilliams.com/katt/ |title=Biography}}</ref><ref name="Katt Williams Biography 2">{{cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/people/katt-williams-21129883 |title=Katt Williams biography}}</ref>
Williams honed his comic delivery by performing his routine in clubs nationwide, from [[Oklahoma]] to [[Oakland, California|Oakland]]. By 1999, Katt had become an established comic, appearing on stage at the likes of [[The Improv]], The Comedy Club, [[The Icehouse]] and The Hollywood Park Casino. Most notably he appeared on [[Black Entertainment Television|BET]]'s ''[[Comic View]]'' as Katt "In the Hat" Williams.<ref name="Katt Williams Biography 1"/><ref name="Katt Williams Biography 2"/>
Williams starred in his first comedy special in 2006 entitled ''Katt Williams: Live: Let a Playa Play''. His second & first [[HBO]] stand-up special was 2006's ''The Pimp Chronicles, Pt. 1'', with his comedy piece "This Shit Right Here Nigga, This Shit Right Here Nigga".<ref name="Katt Williams Biography 1"/> In 2007 Williams was offered a movie/standup which he entitled ''[[American Hustle (2007 film)|American Hustle]]''. The film had critical success and established Williams as a mainstream comedian.<ref name="Katt Williams Biography 1"/><ref name=LASentinel>{{cite news|last=Williams|first=Kam|title=Katt Williams: American Hustle|url=http://www.lasentinel.net/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=8388:katt-williams-american-hustle&catid=58:movies&Itemid=148|accessdate=May 9, 2013|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Sentinel]]}}</ref> In 2008 Williams released his second [[HBO]] comedy special entitled ''It's Pimpin' Pimpin''', with Williams doing more [[Political]] standup.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsblaze.com/story/20081117175231kamw.nb/topstory.html |title=Katt Williams: It's Pimpin' DVD Review |publisher=Newsblaze.com |date=2008-11-17 |accessdate=2014-05-02}}</ref> In 2012, after a four-year haitus, Williams returned to stand up in his third HBO comedy special, entitled ''Kattpacalypse''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chud.com/114161/dvd-review-katt-williams-kattpacalypse/ |title=DVD Review: Katt Williams – Kattpacalypse |publisher=CHUD.com |date= |accessdate=2014-05-02}}</ref>
On December 3, 2012, Williams announced the end of his stand-up comedy career, a day after a bizarre incident in [[Seattle, Washington]] that landed him in jail.<ref>{{cite news|title=Katt Williams: 'I'm kinda done' with stand-up comedy career |url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/12/04/showbiz/katt-williams-done-comedy/index.html?eref=rss_mostpopular/ | work=CNN.com | date=December 3, 2012}}</ref> However, just 3 days later, Williams announced he was coming out of retirement.<ref>{{cite news|title=Katt Williams Not Retiring From Stand-Up Comedy, Just Felt Unappreciated |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/12/06/katt-williams-not-retiring-stand-up-comedy-quitting-unappreciated_n_2251769.html | work=huffingtonpost.com | date=December 6, 2012}}</ref>
As of late 2013, Williams was on his "Growth Spurt" Tour.<ref>{{cite web|author=2013 |url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwcomedy/article/Katt-Williams-Presents-THE-KATT-IS-BACK-TOUR-in-Las-Vegas-119-20131108 |title=Katt Williams Presents THE KATT IS BACK TOUR in Las Vegas, 11/9 - BWWComedyWorld |publisher=Broadwayworld.com |date= |accessdate=2014-05-02}}</ref>
On August 16, 2014, Williams returned with a new HBO special titled ''Katt Williams: Priceless: Afterlife'', which was directed by [[Spike Lee]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.indiewire.com/shadowandact/spike-lee-will-direct-katt-williams-return-to-hbo-in-new-comedy-special|title=Spike Lee Will Direct Katt Williams' Return to HBO In New - Shadow and Act|author=Tambay A. Obenson|date=8 May 2014|work=Shadow and Act}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/katt-williams-priceless-afterlife-tv-review-article-1.1904969 | location=New York | work=Daily News | title='Katt Williams: Priceless: Afterlife,' TV review | date=August 16, 2014}}</ref>
On September 3, 2015, during an interview, Williams would announce and describe the name of his new upcoming tour entitled "Conspiracy Theory" stating, "The conspiracy conversation is a conversation that we are all familiar with. We know that there are conspiracies out there, but this is a conversation that encompasses a lot of things that aren't being discussed other places. That's the basis for all conspiracy theories: the fact that there is hidden information out there, and how our process changes about things that we thought we used to know. We all, at some point, if we're are at a certain age, we grew up thinking Pluto was a planet. This is probably going to go down as one of my finest works, just because it's a collection of forbidden topics that we can't seem to get answered. I am one of the rare urban public officials. Part of my guarantee in my ticket price is that I'm going to be talking about what we are talking about now, and discussing from now to the next time we see [me] again. This is the open discussion that we've had since 2003. This is what it is about."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/katt-williams-announces-conspiracy-theory-tour-20150903|title=Katt Williams Announces 'Conspiracy Theory' Tour|work=Rolling Stone}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/katt-williams-announces-conspiracy-theory-national-tour-300143031.html|title=Katt Williams Announces Conspiracy Theory National Tour|author=Entertainment Fusion Group|date=15 September 2015|publisher=}}</ref>
In 2018, Katt Williams released a new stand up special on [[Netflix]], shot in [[Jacksonville, Florida]], titled ''Great America''.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/16/arts/television/whats-on-tv-tuesday-katt-williams-great-america-and-black-lightning.html|title=What’s on TV Tuesday: ‘Katt Williams: Great America’ and ‘Black Lightning’|date=2018-01-16|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-05-17|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
===Film and television career=== In 2002, Williams made his acting debut on ''[[NYPD Blue]]''. He gained notoriety on ''[[Wild 'n Out]]'', in which he appeared for several seasons.<ref name="Katt Williams Biography 1"/><ref name="Katt Williams Biography 2"/> Williams also appeared in the official music video for Wild 'n Out colleague [[Nick Cannon]]'s single '[[Gigolo (Nick Cannon song)|Gigolo]]' in 2003.
In 2007, he provided the voice of A Pimp Named Slickback in ''[[The Boondocks (TV series)|The Boondocks]]''; he plays himself as an on-stage [[Stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]] in ''[[Grand Theft Auto IV]]'' performing several routines, including an abbreviated version of one of his routines from ''[[Katt Williams: American Hustle]]''; and Williams has appeared in several episodes of ''[[My Wife and Kids]]'' as character Bobby Shaw. He was also the roastmaster of the [[Comedy Central Roast]] of [[Flavor Flav]].<ref name="Katt Williams Biography 1"/><ref name="Katt Williams Biography 2"/>
Williams has also played supporting characters in films, such as ''[[First Sunday]]'' and ''[[Norbit]]'', but is more widely recognized for his character Money Mike in ''[[Friday After Next]]''.<ref name="Katt Williams Biography 1"/><ref name="Katt Williams Biography 2"/>
===Music career=== He has also used the Money Mike stage name when rapping for songs by such artists as [[Baby Bash]], [[The Game (rapper)|The Game]], and [[Suga Free]]. In 2006 William's joined well known New York rapper [[Cam'ron]]'s group [[The Diplomats]] but was never signed as an official artist for the label.<ref>{{cite web|author=Chris Richburg |url=http://allhiphop.com/2007/01/30/katt-williams-rapcomedy-album-on-the-way-new-films-tv-show-in-the-works/ |title=Katt Williams Rap/Comedy Album On The Way, New Films, TV Show In The Works |publisher=AllHipHop.com |date=2007-01-30 |accessdate=2014-05-02}}</ref> On January 29, 2009 Williams released his debut studio/live album entitled ''[[It's Pimpin' Pimpin']]''. On November 19, 2013 Williams & [[Hell Rell]] released a diss song to [[Atlanta]] rapper [[Trinidad James]] entitled "Lames In The Game" due to comments made by the rapper about the state of current [[Hip Hop]] music.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vibe.com/article/new-music-hell-rell-and-katt-williams-diss-trinidad-james-lames-game |title=New Music: Hell Rell And Katt Williams Diss Trinidad James With 'Lames In The Game' |publisher=Vibe |date=2013-11-19 |accessdate=2014-05-02}}</ref>
==Incidents at live shows== On August 27, 2011, his performance at the [[Celebrity Theatre]] in [[Phoenix, Arizona]] was marred by an incident during which Williams responded to a heckler, identified as being of [[Mexican people|Mexican]] descent, with an angry tirade that included Williams shouting "...so if you love Mexico, bitch, get the fuck over there!"<ref>{{cite video |people=[[The Young Turks]] |year=2011 |title=Anti-Mexican Rant By Comedian Katt Williams |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fU4neO7FGZI |medium= |language= |trans_title= |publisher= |location= |accessdate=November 17, 2012 |time= |id= |isbn= |oclc= |quote= |ref= }}</ref> In an interview following the performance, Williams stated that the incident was precipitated by the heckler. "If a person starts their heckling with 'f' America, then that gives me the right to defend my country," Williams said. Williams offered no apology for his remarks during the performance, stating "I don't think I need to apologize for being pro-American."<ref>{{cite news |title=Katt Williams explains apology for Mexico remarks |url=http://articles.cnn.com/2011-09-03/entertainment/katt.williams.rant_1_apology-anti-gay-remarks-comedian-katt-williams|publisher=[[CNN]] |date=September 3, 2011 |accessdate=November 17, 2012}}</ref>
Two live performances in November 2012 ended early because of Williams' confrontational behavior. A November 1 performance at the [[Wells Fargo Theatre]] in [[Denver]] ended after Williams jumped off the stage to confront a heckler.<ref>{{cite news |title=Katt Williams fans furious after bizarre Denver show |first=John |last=Wenzel |url=http://www.denverpost.com/news/ci_21917969/katt-williams-fans-furious-after-bizarre-denver-show |newspaper=denverpost.com |date=3 November 2012 |accessdate=November 17, 2012}}</ref> A November 16 performance at the [[Oracle Arena]] in [[Oakland]] ended after Williams again entered into a profanity-laced confrontation with a heckler and was assisted off stage by his own security staff.<ref>{{cite news |title=Comedian Katt Williams' onstage meltdown in Oakland brings angry response from fans |first=Daniel |last=Jimenez |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/ci_22017339/comedian-katt-williams-stage-meltdown-brings-angry-response?source=most_viewed |newspaper=MercuryNews.com |date=17 November 2012 |accessdate=November 17, 2012}}</ref>
==Legal issues== On November 13, 2006, Williams was arrested at [[Los Angeles International Airport]] after a stolen gun was found in his briefcase.<ref>{{cite news|title=Katt Williams arrested on gun charge at LAX|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2006-11-07-kat-williams_x.htm | work=USA Today | date=November 7, 2006}}</ref> On December 14, 2006, Williams pleaded no contest to a misdemeanor count of carrying a concealed firearm and was sentenced to three years probation, ordered to pay restitution, and was given credit for the three days he spent in jail.<ref name=6abc.com />
In November 2010, Williams was arrested by police while working on a film in [[Coweta County, Georgia]]. He was accused of stealing $3,500 worth of coins and jewelry. He was released the following day on a $40,000 bond.<ref>{{cite news|title=Katt Williams released, facing burglary charge|date=November 10, 2009|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/SHOWBIZ/TV/11/10/katt.williams.arrest/index.html | publisher=CNN| archivedate= November 13, 2009 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20091113122103/http://www.cnn.com/2009/SHOWBIZ/TV/11/10/katt.williams.arrest/index.html | deadurl=no}}</ref> Police later charged Williams with burglary and criminal trespass.<ref name="News Report">{{cite web|url=http://www.worldstarhiphop.com/videos/video.php?v=wshhtAV22NQc6IVVh8th |title=Katt Williams Speaks Out On Being Detained At Wal-Mart! "This Is A Witch Hunt" (Cops Damaging $1,000's Of His Equipment For No Reason) |publisher=[[WorldStarHipHop]] |date=December 5, 2009 |accessdate=May 9, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6hNa7iWbO?url=http://www.worldstarhiphop.com/videos/video.php?v=wshhtAV22NQc6IVVh8th |archivedate=May 9, 2016 |df= }}</ref><!--video does not appear to be archivable; the page otherwise was archived at https://www.webcitation.org/6hNa7iWbO?url=http://www.worldstarhiphop.com/videos/video.php?v%3DwshhtAV22NQc6IVVh8th on May 9, 2016-->
On June 11, 2011, Williams was arrested in connection with an alleged assault on a tractor driver. The alleged victim said three women approached his tractor at around 4:30 p.m. local time and attacked him with rocks and dirt clods, causing him facial injuries.<ref>{{cite web|title=Katt Williams Arrested in Assault on Tractor Driver | url= http://abclocal.go.com/kfsn/story?section=news/entertainment&id=8191171| publisher=[[KFSN-TV]]|location= Fresno, California|date= June 14, 2011 |accessdate= May 9, 2016| archivedate= January 13, 2016| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160113185333/http://abc30.com/archive/8191171/ | deadurl=no}}</ref> Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department officers arrived on the scene and arrested the three women for assault with a deadly weapon and Williams for felony intimidation of a witness.<ref name=tmztractor>{{cite news|title= Katt Williams Arrested -- Let The Tractor Driver Go!|url=http://www.tmz.com/2011/06/13/katt-williams-arrest-tractor-standoff-comic-los-angeles-arrest/ | publisher=TMZ.com | date=June 13, 2011| archivedate=October 20, 2015 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20151020025818/http://www.tmz.com/2011/06/13/katt-williams-arrest-tractor-standoff-comic-los-angeles-arrest/ | deadurl=no}}</ref> Williams was booked into jail and released that same night on $50,000 bail.<ref name=tmztractor/>
On November 15, 2012, he was arrested in Oakland, California on charges of suspicion of assault with a deadly weapon for allegedly beating an 18-year-old [[Berkeley, California]] man with a bottle aboard Williams' tour bus.<ref name="St. Clair">{{cite news |title=Katt Williams arrested in Oakland after show, accused of hitting man with a bottle |first=Katy |last=St. Clair |url=http://www.sfexaminer.com/katt-williams-arrested-in-oakland-after-show-accused-of-hitting-man-with-a-bottle/|newspaper=[[San Francisco Examiner]] |date=November 15, 2012 |accessdate=November 17, 2012| archivedate=May 9, 2016| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160509161355/http://www.sfexaminer.com/katt-williams-arrested-in-oakland-after-show-accused-of-hitting-man-with-a-bottle/ | deadurl=no}}</ref>
An attendee of Williams' aborted November 16, 2012 performance at the Oracle Arena in Oakland filed a [[class action lawsuit]] days after the event, seeking compensation for himself and "all others who paid money for a show and got nothing but Katt Williams' nonperformance."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.eastbaytimes.com/trivalleyherald/ci_22068396/katt-williams-meltdown-oakland-leads-lawsuit-from-disappointed|title=Katt Williams' meltdown in Oakland leads to lawsuit from disappointed fan|last=Hurd|first=Rick|date=November 27, 2012|work=[[East Bay Times]]|accessdate=May 9, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160509161630/http://www.eastbaytimes.com/trivalleyherald/ci_22068396/katt-williams-meltdown-oakland-leads-lawsuit-from-disappointed|archivedate=May 9, 2016|deadurl=yes|agency=[[Contra Costa Times]]}}</ref>
On December 2, 2012, he was arrested in Seattle after he allegedly got into a dispute at a bar in South Lake Union. Williams' arrest came after his no-show November 29, 2012 for the first night of a planned two-night engagement at the Paramount Theatre.<ref name="seattletimes.com">{{cite news|title= Stand-up comic arrested after dispute |url=http://blogs.seattletimes.com/today/2012/12/stand-up-comic-arrested-after-dispute/|first=Linda|last= Shaw | work=[[The Seattle Times]] | date=December 2, 2012| archivedate= March 3, 2016|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160303234055/http://blogs.seattletimes.com/today/2012/12/stand-up-comic-arrested-after-dispute/ | deadurl=no}}</ref> Five days later, Williams was arrested in [[Dunnigan, California]] on a bench warrant arising from a November 25, 2012, incident in [[Sacramento, California|Sacramento]] during which he allegedly drove a three-wheeled motorbike on a sidewalk and refused to stop for police. The resulting chase was halted due to safety concerns, and the bench warrant issued, after Williams narrowly missed several bystanders.<ref name="komonews">{{cite news|title=Katt Williams arrested again|url=http://www.komonews.com/news/entertainment/Katt-Williams-arrested-again-182735311.html|work=komonews.com|date=December 9, 2012}}</ref>
On December 28, 2012, Williams was arrested in Los Angeles on child endangerment charges. He was held in lieu of $100,000 bail, and his four children were placed in [[protective custody]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Katt Williams Arrested For Child Endangerment, May Face Felony Charges |url=http://www.inquisitr.com/458817/katt-williams-arrested-for-child-endangerment-may-face-felony-charges/|publisher=inquisitr.com|accessdate=December 29, 2012}}</ref>
On January 8, 2013, he was arrested at his LA home after failing to appear in Sacramento to answer the November 25 motorbike charges.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kcra.com/news/Katt-Williams-arrested-in-LA-on-Sacramento-bench-warrant/-/11797728/18061108/-/djvj2bz/-/index.html |title=Katt Williams arrested in LA on Sacramento bench warrant | News - KCRA Home |publisher=Kcra.com |date=January 8, 2013 |accessdate=May 2, 2014}}</ref>
On October 29, 2014, Williams and [[Suge Knight]] were arrested for the theft of a camera from a female photographer in [[Beverly Hills, California|Beverly Hills]] on September 5.<ref>{{cite news |last=Almasy |first=Steve |url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/10/29/showbiz/suge-knight-katt-williams-arrested/index.html?hpt=hp_t2 |title=Suge Knight, Katt Williams arrested in paparazzi camera theft case |work=[[CNN]] |date=October 29, 2014 |accessdate=October 30, 2014}}</ref> In April 2017 Williams plead no contest to the charge of robbery and was ordered to undertake a year of anger management charges as well as receiving three years' probation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-katt-williams-plea-20170417-story.html|title=Comedian Katt Williams ordered to complete anger management classes in Beverly Hills robbery case – LA Times|first=James|last=Queally|publisher=}}</ref>
On February 29, 2016, Williams was arrested in [[Gainesville, Georgia]] after a clerk at a swimming-pool store said Katt hit him. Katt was lying face down with his hands behind his back when police arrived.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fox13memphis.com/news/comedian-katt-williams-arrested-in-georgia/131166945|title=Comedian Katt Williams arrested in Georgia|publisher=WHBQ}}</ref>
On April 27, 2016, Williams was arrested in [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]] and charged with battery after allegedly throwing a salt shaker at the manager of Spondivits, a local restaurant. The manager claimed to have been hit in the mouth with the salt shaker after Williams' group was denied preferential seating.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://hiphopdx.com/news/id.38563/title.katt-williams-arrested-for-battery-after-salt-shaker-incident|title=Katt Williams Arrested For Battery After Salt Shaker Incident|last=Baker|first=Soren|date=April 28, 2016|work=HipHopDX|access-date=May 8, 2016|via=}}</ref>
He was arrested July 24, 2016 on suspicion of battery after an altercation with a woman at the Sportsman's Lodge, a hotel in [[Sherman Oaks, California]].<ref>{{cite web| url= http://www.tmz.com/2016/07/24/katt-williams-accused-assault-detained/ | title=Katt Williams Arrested for Battery on a Woman|date=July 24, 2016|accessdate=July 29, 2016| publisher= TMZ.com |archivedate=July 29, 2016| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160729192321/http://www.tmz.com/2016/07/24/katt-williams-accused-assault-detained/ | deadurl=no }}</ref>
On September 15, 2016, Williams was arrested in Fulton County, Georgia, on a charge of second-degree criminal damage to property, after having turned himself in on a warrant for failing to appear in court for the April 27 incident. This new arrest involved a February 28, 2016, allegation that the comedian threw a man's cellphone.<ref name=AP09-16-16>{{cite news | url = http://bigstory.ap.org/article/7f8dc341cdce494f92afac8d70da3d45/comedian-katt-williams-arrested-again-booked-jail| title= Comedian Katt Williams arrested again over cellphone dispute|first1=Jeff|last1=Martin|first2=Kate|last2=Brumback| agency=[[Associated Press]] | date= September 16, 2016 | accessdate=September 16, 2016 | archivedate= September 17, 2016 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160917174215/http://bigstory.ap.org/article/7f8dc341cdce494f92afac8d70da3d45/comedian-katt-williams-arrested-again-booked-jail| deadurl=no}}</ref>
==Personal life== Williams briefly joined the [[Nation of Islam]] while living in the [[San Francisco Bay Area]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kattwilliams.com/biography |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070620124532/http://www.kattwilliams.com/biography/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2007-06-20 |title=Biography |accessdate=2016-07-30 |df= }}</ref>
Williams is the father of eight children, including two biological children named Micah and Jessica,<ref>{{cite web|title=Katt Williams Biography!
